did.unittitle: Christina V. Pacosz diaries and publications 1899-2011, 1980-2004
did.abstract: Widely published American Polish poet whose life is at the heart of her poetry; diaries and publications.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Christina V. Pacosz (donor no. 10030) in 2008, 2010 and 2012.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the donor until her passing.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Christina V. Pacosz diaries and publications, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Christina V. Pacosz was born and raised in Detroit, Michigan. Her parents were Sophia Anna Suchocka Kostrzewska and Walter Frank Pacosz. She began her writing as a child because of her parent's encouragement. Pacosz received her BS from Wayne State University in 1970. She taught school in Michigan for a few years, and then traveled westward where she taught special education in Estacada, Oregon. Wherever she taught, she also found time to write poetry. In 1986, she went on to study Polish and Jewish relations at the Jagiellonian University, in Krakow, Poland. During her career Pacosz has received several fellowships, awards and has been appointed as visiting artist at the Asheville Buncombe Technical Community College and the Central Piedmont Community College in Charlotte, N.C. In the early 1990s, she taught children with learning disabilities in Alaska. She eventually came to reside in Kansas City, Missouri. Christina V. Pacosz is an accomplished poet with a significant body of published and unpublished poems and prose.

scopecontent.p: This collection gives the researcher an insight into the works and mind of an American born Polish poet. It is divided into two series: Personal information and Published Works.

The Personal information series includes biographical materials, family records, correspondence, and personal diaries. The diaries contain a mixture of information such as the poet's dreams, to do lists, relationships, thoughts, poetry, daily life, travel and budgets.

The Published works series is divided into sub series, which include 2 Music scores, Web materials, Newspapers, CD and DVD Collection, Anthologies, and Works in Periodicals. The Anthologies are arranged chronologically and the periodicals are arranged alphabetically. Description of published works includes works available online via web sites not maintained by the University of Michigan. Web site links are valid as of December 10, 2012.
